document.docAuthor: Ugalde, Diana, Fernandez, Julio C. C., Gómez, Patricia, Lôbo-Hajdu, Gisele & Simões, Nuno
document.masterDocTitle: An update on the diversity of marine sponges in the southern Gulf of Mexico coral reefs

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: An update on the diversity of marine sponges in the southern Gulf of Mexico coral reefs

subSubSection.paragraph:
Synonymy and references:
Petrosia weinbergi van Soest (1980: 75)
,
Hajdu et al. (2011: 196)
and
Muricy et al. (2011: 107)
;
Petrosia sp.
, see references compiled in
Muricy et al. (2011: 107)
;
Petrosia ( Petrosia ) weinbergi ,
Muricy et al. (2011: 107)
, Rützler (2014: 90) and van Soest (2017: 37) .

Material examined.
CNPGG-2203, Cayo Arcas reef ( 20.19491°N , - 91.95741°W ),
5.1 m depth
, coll. Diana Ugalde ,
20 August 2018
;
CNPGG-2249, Triangulo Oeste reef ( 20.85178°N , - 92.30963°W ),
23 m depth
, coll. Oscar Bocardo ,
09 September 2017
;
CNPGG-2392, Hornos reef ( 19.19083°N , - 96.11777°W ),
2.7 m depth
, coll. Diana Ugalde ,
27 August 2018
;
CNPGG-2434, Cabezo reef ( 19.05086°N , - 95.82388°W ),
8.3 m depth
, coll. Diana Ugalde ,
30 August 2018
;
CNPGG-2448, Isla Verde reef ( 19.20588°N , - 96.07305°W ),
7.2 m depth
, coll. Diana Ugalde ,
31 August 2018
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 35.
Petrosia ( Petrosia ) weinbergi van Soest, 1980
(CNPGG-2249), skeleton and spicules: A. tangential section of the skeleton of the ectosomal region; B. detail of the ectosomal region; C. transversal section of the skeleton; D. oxeas, 1― oxeas I, 2―oxeas II, 3―oxeas III and 4―oxeas IV. Scale bars: A 500 µm; B–C = 100 µm; D = 50 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Mexico ( Maas-Vargas 2004 ; Gómez 2011 ; current records), Cuba , other countries in the Caribbean Sea, Guyana , to Brazil ( van Soest 2017 ).

Remarks. Our study presents the second record of
P. ( P. ) weinbergi
for the GoM, following Gómez (2011) . This species is not present in recent studies on sponges from the region. Our specimens match in all their characteristics the description by van Soest (1980) .
